    A list of 205 national and international academic meetings in various disciplines for key features of inclusivity and sustainability and propose solutions to make conferences more modern, effective, equitable and intellectually productive for the research community and environmentally sustainable for our planet.

ECFG15(15th European Conference on Fungal Genetics)

Year it was held: 2020

Years the conferences has been held: 15

Disciplines: Fungal Genetics

Gender balance/diversity statement: None

Total Attendance Cost (US dollars): $2000-$4000

Registration Cost (US dollars): $271-$704

Travel Carbon Footprint (tons of CO2) for all conference attendees: 1500

Other Carbon Footprint (tons of CO2) for all conference attendees: 300

Associated Scientific Society/Organization: Not applicable

Approx number of Society members (as of 2018): Not Applicable

Approximate Number of Conference Attendees (Exhibitors included): 1000

Geographic Location(s): Rome, Italy

Years held (Every 6 months, Annual, Biannual, Triannual): Biennial

Host, Funders and Sponsors: Elsevier publishing group, Syngenta, Sapienza Universite Di Roma. Novozymes, FEMS (Federation of European Microbiological Soceties)

Digital or Virtual Options: ?

Digital Archives (Recorded talks & slides): ?

Electronic program dissemination:

On-site Maternity Facilities: None

On-site Childcare Facilities/Services: None

Caregiver grant: None

Career Development Events and Workshops: None

ECR promotion events: None

Travel awards for ECRs: Yes (The FEMS grant will allow the ECFG Organizing Committee to financially support a maximum of 20 participants. The selected participants will receive 400 euro each to cover travel and accommodation expenses: Eligibility: be a member of a FEMS Member Society* or be recommended by such a member be an Early Career Scientist** be an Active Microbiologist be presenting author at the meeting (oral or poster)

Code of conduct: None

Safety Instructions/Apps: None

Session chair gender balance:

Conference chair gender balance: Organizing committee: 4 Men: 1 Woman
